title.narrative: Enhancing life-saving support through continuation integrated Health and Nutrition with limited WASH in Health and Nutrition among vulnerable conflict affected populations in South Darfur

description.narrative:
Enhancing life-saving support through continuation integrated Health and Nutrition with limited WASH in Health and Nutrition among vulnerable conflict affected populations in South Darfur
World Vision in partnership with NaHA & NIDO are pleased to submit an integrated response to provide essential Health & Nutrition with basic WASH services in S.Darfur to address:1) increased quality of CMAM services to enhance treatment and prevention of acute malnutrition in children U5 years and Pregnant and lactating women; 2) Improve access to quality Primary Health services (maternal and child health services and 3) Improved access to WASH facilities in health and Nutrition centres. Action is inclusive and covers all population segments i.e host communities (38%); IDPs (40%); returnees (2%) in Nyala North, Belil, Mershing, Nitegea, Alsalam and Rehaidailberdi & refugees (20%) in Buram and Al Radoum. Action harnesses organisational, technical and operational capacities of WV & partners as a result of existing presence & longstanding relationships with communities. Health response prioritises life saving treatment through Comprehensive Health Package, provision of essential drugs, ante-natal care and health systems strengthening. Nutrition interventions addresses management of SAM & GAM by screening and treatment of PLW & U5s for malnutrition, immunization for U1 and women of reproductive age, early detection and case finding through community management, staff training and OTP sites rehabilitation. WASH services to increase water access to health facilities and create a safe environment by latrines rehabilitation, provision of hand washing facilities, waste disposal pits and hygiene promotion. Basic protection to address main concerns will be mainstreamed and closely linked to 'do no harm' principle, ensuring meaningful access, accountability, participation and empowerment. Modification request made to address urgent needs of newly arrived IDPs providing continuum of care for nutrition services, increase water access, shelter provision and preparedness for disease outbreak response.
